data.name: Anshar Online
data.description:
NEW! New control options are available:  "Head for Flight", "Gaze to Turn" and "Remote Controller for Flight". 

Anshar Online is an online multiplayer space shooter. Team up with players and fight intense coop battles in over 50 missions, contracts and assaults, against ever more challenging opponents. 

Compete against other players in an exhilarating race to determine who among you is the fastest, and battle in an 8-player death match to determine who is the top ace. 

Each successful mission will increase your level and skill, preparing you for the next fight. Starting out as a fighter, you will customize your ship to your liking by mounting equipment obtained through in-game loot drops, as well as by selecting upgrades in exchange for obtained resources. Or switch ship classes and get yourself a tank or engineer ship, each with specialized weaponry, unique special abilities, and a variety of skins, which allow you and your party to be better equipped to take on each new challenge.

changelog.change_log:
Version 1.2 

New features:

New control schemes for the Gear VR, Oculus Go and Oculus Rift have been added depending on the available controllers. In the Cockpit Menu -> Control Options there are now three new options: "Head for Flight", "Gaze to Turn" and "Remote Controller for Flight". These control schemes have their own comfort values ("comfortable", "moderate" or "intense").
- The first control scheme "Head for Flight" is the default one in Anshar Online. It has two options: "Tunnel Vision", to enable/disable the visual effect that darkens the view when the ship quickly turns and that it reduces motion sickness, and "Turning with Oculus Go/Gear Vr controller" to allow to quick turn in Oculus GO or Gear VR by clicking on the left and right side of the remote controller' s touchpad to turn left or right.
- The second control scheme is "Gaze to turn" to control the ship by looking in the direction the player wants to fly. In that case the ship continues to steer in that direction until looking forward. This control scheme has three options: "Turning Gaze Sensitivity" to change how much the player has to move the gaze before starting a turn, "Tunnel Vision" and "Turning with Oculus Go/Gear Vr controller", as described before for the control scheme "Head for Flight".
- The third control scheme is "Remote Controller (Gear VR controller, Oculus Go controller, Oculus Touch, Oculus Gamepad) for Flight". Using this control scheme the ship is free to rotate in three dimensions: yaw, pitch and roll (the last option is not available for Oculus Go and Gear VR). The options "Yaw Sensitivity", "Pitch Sensitivity" and "Roll Sensitivity" allow to change the related angle sensitivity. Another option is "Yaw/Pitch/Roll Deadzone" to change how much the player has to move the controller before getting a response. The option “Inverted Pitch” allows to invert the pitch axis of the remote controller.

Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where a user will remain on a black screen without a prompt until reconnecting if internet connection is lost before ‘Confirming’ a mission 
- Fixed an issue where in some missions, the 'cooldown' bar will temporarily appear grayed out when special abilities are re-activated
- Fixed an issue where application exit can be accidentally triggered
- Fixed an issue where Written messages in the chat box are hidden after closing the chat
- Fixed an issue where the text in the menu prompts the user to plug in headphones to use VoIP
- Fixed an issue where VoIP instructions are missing words when observed in the Menus screen throughout the title
- Fixed an issue where frequently, the Boost Power Up icon remains on-screen after spamming the secondary weapon button where 3 Power ups are in line 
- Fixed an issue where opening the Radial Menu while Using the Snap Turn makes the Radial Menu lock persist for one Snap Turn 
- Fixed an issue where no credits rewarded after completing a PVP match with 7 or more players 
- Fixed an issue where SFX is played during HUD tutorial while all sound settings are set to mute
- Fixed an issue where 'Items Bag Full' message stays on screen if the user dies soon after collecting an item with a full bag
- Fixed an issue where enemy lock-on audio cue triggers when an ally fires Healing Orb at User

Version 1.1 

New features:

- A new control scheme for the Gear VR Controller and the Oculus Go Controller has been added. It allows the player to quick turn by clicking on the right side of the controller touchpad to turn right and the left side of the controller touchpad to turn left. To enable/disable this, go to Cockpit Menu -> Control Options.
- A new race has been added in the desert of the planet Omnia Prime.
- A new interest point to access the Hangar has been added, located in front and to the right of spawn.
- New players are shown indicators to go to the Hangar as well as enter the shop when they have not yet done so, after completing the first mission and returning to Judgement City.
- Players can no longer start parties or invite other players to parties within deathmatches. 
- Added friends now appear correctly in the friends menu.

Improvements:

- The interest points from missions 5 to 10 have been brought forward and are no longer located behind the player when they spawn.
- Race interest points have been relocated. They are now all regrouped on top of the stadium.

Fixes:

- Fixed various graphical and mesh issues throughout the game.
- Fixed an issue where players would fly with mission end panels, resulting in them being unable to quit or restart.
- Fixed an issue in “[Mission 3] The Trojan Horse” where using a barrage would override the protection offered by rail drones.
- Fixed various issues where the cockpit menu would show flickering elements depending on the player’s location.
- Fixed an issue for Rift where the application could crash on quit.
- Fixed an issue where users could face a permanent black screen when confirming a mission while the network connection experiences difficulties.
- Fixed an issue where recently added friends would not appear in the in-game friends list in the menus.
- Fixed an issue where special abilities could be briefly activated when respawning in chase sequences.
- Fixed an issue in “[Mission 2] Two for One Special” where the police ship would appear in front of the user when respawning.
- Fixed an issue where enemies would display different HP values to different users if a new player joined.
- Fixed an issue in “[Mission 4] The Plot Thickens” where players could use their teleport ability while following a rail drone.
- Fixed an issue for Gear VR and Oculus Go where keys would be shown instead of localized strings if at first launch the localization could not be downloaded. 
- Fixed an issue where the mission end panel displayed wrong stat values when leveling up while being sidekicked. 
- Fixed on issue in “[Mission 3] The Trojan Horse” where doors could be crossed from both directions, leading to confusing situations. Doors can now be crossed in 1 direction only.
- Fixed various graphical issues in the Interior PvP Arena
- Fixed an issue where accessing menus would override the phasing VFX
- Fixed an issue for the race countdown timer which would say “0 second” rather than “0 seconds”.
- Fixed an issue where players in a menu, would respawn near a chased target without their menu within chase contracts. 
- Fixed an issue where tagged beacons could not be discarded
- Fixed an issue where crashing on top of of the shop ship within Judgement City could result in the players entering a non-functional state, where they were no longer crashing against geometry and couldn’t enter missions. 
- Fixed an issue where obtaining 2 achievements at once would make the first one disappear too fast
- Fixed an issue where players using the Touch controllers on Rift or gamepads on all platforms could exceed player boundaries
- Fixed an issue where engine SFX could still be heard after a player crashed
- Fixed an issue in ”[Mission 10] A Galactic Minute” where on occasion a player could already move before the start of the race
- Fixed an issue in “[Mission 13] The Perils of Infinium” where on occasion the boss would clip outside of the room after charging for a player
- Fixed an issue where music was uncomfortably loud when loading into the single-player mode of the exterior PvP map
- Fixed an issue in contract “More Than You Can Chew” where an enemy would path through a mountain
- Fixed an issue where cutscene audio could get out of sync after opening the Universal Menu or removing the headset during cutscenes. 
- Fixed an issue where updating the Oculus friends list would not delete removed friends.
- Fixed an issue in “[Assault] End of the Blood Corps” where players could escape a stasis field by accessing the menu. 
- Fixed an issue where players would spawn facing the wrong direction, after using snap-turn on death. 
- Fixed an issue where special abilities would not longer be available if they were activated at the same time the player died. 
- Fixed an issue in “[Contract] Homefront” where the engineer’s damage orb could not hit ground turrets. 
- Fixed an issue where the user’s name would be replaced by “Player: 00”, if public parties were created outside Judgement City. 
- Fixed an issue with grammar in the Structure and Technology tooltips within the Hangar.
- Fixed an issue where beacons could not be placed in various levels, primarily in the Annunaki region.
- Fixed an issue in “[Assault] Beetle Battle” where on rare occasions the cursor would disappear in the mission end panel.
- Fixed various issues where crashing or taking interest points while the bad internet connection message was displayed would result in the player no longer being able to play. 
- Fixed an issue where the skins shop would not appropriately display skins already owned.
- Fixed an issue where squad interaction options would allow players to tag opponents in a deathmatch, revealing their position even when invisible.
